required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Expression of Toll-like Receptors 3 , 7 and 9 in Peripheral Blood Mononuclear Cells of COVID-19 Patients
clinical_study.official_title: Expression of Toll-like Receptors 3 , 7 and 9 in Peripheral Blood Mononuclear Cells of COVID-19 Patients

brief_summary.textblock: The aim of the study is to assess the expression of TLR 3, 7, and 9 in the population of peripheral blood mononuclear cells (PBMC) and in B lymphocytes (CD19+), T lymphocytes (CD4+ and CD8+) using flow cytometry in relation to the clinical parameters and outcome of COVID 19 patients .

detailed_description.textblock: Abnormal stimulation of innate immunity may have a great influence on the immunopathogenesis of COVID 19 disease .The involvement of innate immunity receptors-toll-like receptors (TLR)-in the pathogenesis of COVID 19 is not adequately studied. The activation of these receptors by specific ligands is thought to initiate autoimmune processes[1]. TLR stimulation leads to increased expression of proinflammatory cytokines (IL-6, IFN

primary_outcome.measure: Cytokines storm occurrence in COVID-19 patients
primary_outcome.description: To assess whether the expression of toll-like receptors 3,7 and 9 in peripheral blood mononuclear cells related to the clinical status of COVID-19 patients and probability of cytokines storm occurrence

intervention.description: 5 cm blood sample from COVID-19 patients

study_pop.textblock: Patients diagnosed as confirmed COVID-19 when they have a positive result of RT-PCR for SARS-CoV-2 RNA or confirmed diagnosis by typical clinical picture and radiological methods , according to the WHO and Egyptian Ministry of Health and Population (MOH) definitions, at Assiut University Hospital

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patients â‰¥18 years old of both genders.
- Patients diagnosed as confirmed COVID-19 when they have a positive result of RT-PCR for SARS-CoV-2 RNA or confirmed diagnosis by typical clinical picture and radiological methods , according to the WHO and Egyptian Ministry of Health and Population (MOH) definitions, at Assiut University Hospital.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Children less than 18 years.
- Patients refusal to participate in the study

reference.citation: Matthay MA, Zemans RL, Zimmerman GA, Arabi YM, Beitler JR, Mercat A, Herridge M, Randolph AG, Calfee CS. Acute respiratory distress syndrome. Nat Rev Dis Primers. 2019 Mar 14;5(1):18. doi: 10.1038/s41572-019-0069-0. Review.

Mehta P, McAuley DF, Brown M, Sanchez E, Tattersall RS, Manson JJ; HLH Across Speciality Collaboration, UK. COVID-19: consider cytokine storm syndromes and immunosuppression. Lancet. 2020 Mar 28;395(10229):1033-1034. doi: 10.1016/S0140-6736(20)30628-0. Epub 2020 Mar 16.
